definition: to use discretion/to take circumstances into account/to make allowances pertinent to a situation
to pour wine/to drink wine/to deliberate/to consider
see 酌情辦理|酌情办理[zhuo2 qing2 ban4 li3]
to act after full consideration of the actual situation

sentences.english: The office in BeiJing will offer the help according to the condition.

sentences.english: In the operation deliver small dose tiacrium extenuatorily.

sentences.english: When Taiwan's local finance is in difficulty, the central government may subsidize it as is fit for the circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 台湾地方财政遇有困难时，可由中央政府酌情补助。

sentences.english: Liu accused pleaded guilty to a better attitude, as appropriate leniently punished.
sentences.chinese: 被告人刘某认罪态度较好，酌情予以从轻处罚。

sentences.english: Recommend the use of dimensions, remarketing, and click-to-call, as appropriate.

sentences.english: Watering once a week---or less if it rains---is plenty for these types of plants.
sentences.chinese: 浇水的频率为一周一次，下雨时更要酌情减少。

sentences.english: Such orders may be cancelled at the discretion of the Company only.
sentences.chinese: 这些命令只可能在公司的酌情权下会被取消。

sentences.english: A fee may be charged by the Organisers for complying with the request.

sentences.english: If you plan to check-in earlier or check-out later, we will alery an additional charge.
sentences.chinese: 如提前入住或推迟离店，均须酌情加收一定的费用。

sentences.english: Conclusion:The partial middle turbinectomy for middle turbinate in FESS is necessary.

sentences.english: We should also exercise discretion with regard to what we learn.

sentences.english: You can deal with the two students skipping classes as you see fit.
sentences.chinese: 这两个逃课的学生，你们酌情处理吧。

definition: see 酌情辦理|酌情办理[zhuo2 qing2 ban4 li3]
(to do sth) separately/as a separate action
to add or subtract/to increase or decrease/to go up or go down
to assess punishment/to determine the sentence (on a criminal)
to report, requesting approval/written request for instructions
